definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels

sentences.english: The Great Wall of China is one of the wonders of the world.
sentences.chinese: 中國的萬里長城是世界奇觀之一。

sentences.english: Can you join us to visit the Great Wall?
sentences.chinese: 你能和我們在一起參觀萬里長城嗎？

sentences.english: Two-lock and key unparalleled in Beijing, the Great Wall, the first hurdle.
sentences.chinese: 兩京鎖鑰無雙地，萬里長城第一關。

sentences.english: China built the Great Wall to protect against enemy invasions.
sentences.chinese: 中國修建了萬里長城以抵禦敵人入侵。

sentences.english: It took them many years to build the Great Wall.
sentences.chinese: 建成萬里長城花費他們許多年時間。

sentences.english: Has he ever visited the Great Wall?
sentences.chinese: 他曾經參觀過萬里長城嗎？

sentences.english: I know the Great Wall of China.
sentences.chinese: 我知道中國的萬里長城。

sentences.english: To build the Great Wall took them many years.
sentences.chinese: 建成萬里長城花費他們許多年時間。

sentences.english: The Great Wall is symbolic of such a defensive concept.
sentences.chinese: 萬里長城所象徵的就是這種防禦觀念。

sentences.english: The great wall is symbolic of such defensive concept.
sentences.chinese: 萬里長城所象徵的就是這種防禦觀念。

sentences.english: He took photos of the Great Wall.
sentences.chinese: 他拍了一組萬里長城的照片。

sentences.english: Paying a visit to the Great Wall of China.
sentences.chinese: 我很想去參觀中國的萬里長城。

sentences.english: Call it the Great Wall against Walmart.
sentences.chinese: 可以把它稱爲物美的“萬里長城”。

definition: no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
Bashi Channel in the northern part of the Luzon Strait, just south of Taiwan

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
Jiayu Pass in Gansu, at the western terminus of the Great Wall/Jiayuguan prefecture-level city in Gansu
flesh and blood flying (idiom); carnage/people blown to pieces
a thousand pounds hangs by a thread (idiom)/imminent peril/a matter of life or death
